column4: hi. I have this problem installing xubuntu 11.10 (same with newest). Installing via usb flash, but when I choose any option, it does nothing and gives me a blinking cursor only. Would anyone help pls?
what video chip do you use?
seems like the problematic GMA somthing
try the boot option:  nomodeset
no difference
i used .... quiet persistent nomodeset
or the safemodevga option
no difference :). I would just like to enter the rescue mode, that would help me alot.
but when i select Help, i see dots being written, lots of them, fast.
add the boot option:  vga=771
no difference
could try the alternate ISO, it installs in text mode
i AM running from alternate CD. But when i select ANY option, i end up with blinking cursor..
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://www.alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && chmod +x ./alsa-info.sh && ./alsa-info.sh --upload
sorry it took so long: http://www.alsa-project.org/db/?f=e019ff198ac38e216016f281f94c30f1b3356c72
there are no sound cards detected in your system....
I know. But why? The soundcard IS on the mobo. It has jacks and is enabled in bios..
is it enabled in BIOS?
i'd run:   dmesg | less     after a reboot and see if its deteted at boot
dmesg: sharetext.org/YPfM
you need to read that, see where and if the sound device gets seen
i think its not there. But neither is my GPU which works
im sorry. The GPU is there, its just not stated the vendor or model.
